artist: Artist: Edward Ruscha; Author: Edward Ruscha; Publisher: Published by the artist, noted as Heavy Industry Publications, Hollywood, Calif.; Printer: Dick de Ruscha, Los Angeles
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Library Fund
description: Softcover; white cardboard and silver Mylar slipcase; title printed in silver ink on front and spine; new copies of both editions were banded with a white paper strip (belly band) that encircled both book and slipcase; accordian-fold binding; one continuous page, composed of glued-paper segments. This copy: First edition.
markings: Distributor\'s name and address stamped in black ink on title page. MIA ex-library markings on exterior and interior.
provenance: Transferred from MIA Research and Reference Library
text: As the title states, Ruscha's book depicts a complete record of the buildings along Hollywood's famous Sunset Strip. The book's deadpan, documentary feel, and absense of any explanatory text, typified Ruscha's early artist's books. When fully extended, this accordion-fold book measures nearly 25 feet in length.
title: Every Building on the Sunset Strip
